summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, primarily covering the period of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) from July 8, 2019, to August 9, 2019. It includes his daily SHU logs, inventory reports of security equipment, and a daily security inspection form. The logs show routine monitoring with no noted medical complaints. This document is a set of daily administrative logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated June 28, 2019. It includes detailed key count reports from various control points (Control, Lobby, Lockshop, Security Safe), a body alarm testing roster, and a daily fire and security inspection report. The logs show routine prison security procedures and staff assignments. This document is a series of inventory reports from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, detailing equipment, chemical agents, weapons, and ammunition across various locations within the facility. It includes watch call logs and staff assignment forms, indicating standard prison operational procedures and security protocols. This document is a series of inventory reports from the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), detailing equipment, weapons, ammunition, restraints, and communications gear stored in various units and bags. The reports, dated from October 2018 to August 2019, catalog items like firearms, handcuffs, riot gear, and video cameras, indicating standard prison inventory control procedures.

events.title: Epstein placed in Special Housing Unit
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's admission to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York is logged, beginning a period of detailed daily monitoring.

events.title: Daily SHU monitoring of Epstein
events.description: Daily logs track Epstein's status in the SHU, including meals, showers, out-of-cell time for activities like legal visits or recreation, and health checks where he consistently voiced no medical complaints.

events.title: Daily Key Count and Security Inspection
events.description: Routine administrative procedures at MCC New York involving counting keys from multiple control points (Control, Lobby, Lockshop, Security Safe), conducting body alarm tests, and performing daily fire and security inspections.

events.title: MCC Inventory Check - Unit ZA & ZB
events.description: Inventory report conducted for chemical agents, communications equipment (video cameras), and general items (restraints, detectors, flashlights) in Units ZA and ZB.

events.title: MCC Inventory Check - Multiple Locations
events.description: Comprehensive inventory reports for various locations including ITS Office, Escort Bags (1-12), Restraint Bags (1-6), Sub Armory, Ready Room, and Escort Safe, detailing weapons, ammunition, restraints, protective gear, and equipment.

events.title: MCC Inventory Check - Escort Bag
events.description: Inventory report for an Escort Bag, detailing a 9mm pistol, ammunition, badge, and related equipment.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was held in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York from at least July 8, 2019, through the records shown, which extend to August 9, 2019.
The daily SHU logs consistently note under health comments that Epstein 'voices no medical complaints' during the documented period.
The document includes extensive inventory lists of security equipment at MCC New York, such as body alarms, portable radios, chemical agents (OC spray, stingball grenades), and less-lethal launchers.
A Daily Fire and Security Inspection Report form is included, outlining the standard procedures for area searches and equipment checks by correctional staff.
A Daily Key Count log for control center keys is dated Friday, June 28, 2019, indicating the document compilation includes records from that date.
The document is dated Friday, June 28, 2019, which is during the period Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York prior to his death.
It details extensive key control procedures, listing hundreds of keys across multiple rings (A, B, C, D, E, F, G, L, P, Q, S, V) issued from Control, Lobby, Lockshop, and Security Safe.
A 'Body Alarm Testing' attachment lists staff assignments for various units (e.g., UNIT 1, UNIT 2, UNIT 3S, VISITING), indicating routine security equipment checks.
A 'Daily Fire and Security Inspection Report' outlines a comprehensive checklist for staff to inspect their areas, including items like locking devices, keys, ceilings, walls, and census checks.
The document is marked 'Sensitive But Unclassified' and represents standard prison operational logs, showing the administrative environment of the facility.

The MCC New York maintained detailed inventories of security equipment including chemical agents (OC/pepper spray, grenades), weapons (9mm pistols, launchers), ammunition, restraints, and detection devices.

Watch call procedures required staff to check in every half hour, with lieutenants notified if calls were not received within 5 minutes, indicating strict accountability for staff welfare and security.
Inventory reports were marked 'Sensitive But Unclassified' and dated from 2018 and 2019, showing routine security audits during the period Jeffrey Epstein was held at the facility.

The New York MCC maintained detailed inventories of weapons (including Colt and Beretta firearms), ammunition, restraints (handcuffs, leg irons, Martin chains), riot gear, and surveillance equipment (Panasonic and Canon video cameras).
Inventory dates span from October 2018 to August 2019, showing regular equipment checks at the facility.

The reports list specific equipment like 'BOP Badges' (Bureau of Prisons badges), ballistic vests, chemical agents (MK4, OC), and multiple 'Escort Bags' each containing a pistol, magazines, and restraints, indicating protocols for prisoner transport and facility security.
